screeningSummary: Professional paranormal researcher with four-device corroboration of apparition - submitted for peer review

textVariants.text: You're on the air. I understand you're a professional investigator?
Alright, you're on. Professional investigator, huh?
YOU ARE ON THE AIR! A PROFESSIONAL INVESTIGATOR! This is gonna be GOOD!
You're on. Let me guess - you found definitive proof of ghosts?
You're on. So you're an investigator? What about it?
Oh, a PROFESSIONAL investigator! This I gotta hear! What's your story?
You're on. What is your professional background and investigative methodology?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Paranormal researcher with twenty years of experience, Vern. I use scientific methodology - full spectrum cameras, EMF sensors, infrasound detectors. Last month I documented something unprecedented.

textVariants.text: Scientific methodology in this field is rare. What did you document?
Scientific methodology... alright, what'd you document?
TWENTY YEARS of experience with SCIENTIFIC METHODOLOGY! This is AMAZING!
Twenty years. Let me guess - you got definitive proof?
Twenty years, scientific methodology. Fine, what'd you find?
TWENTY YEARS of paranormal research! I LOVE this! What did you document?!
Twenty years of research with scientific instrumentation. What specific phenomenon did you document?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: An apparition captured on four different device types simultaneously. Visual spectrum camera, thermal imaging, EMF sensor, and audio recording. All showing the same phenomenon at the same moment.

textVariants.text: Four devices, same moment. That's significant corroboration.
Four devices, same moment... okay, that's something.
FOUR DIFFERENT DEVICES at the SAME MOMENT! This is INCREDIBLE!
Four devices. Let me guess - they all malfunctioned at once?
Four devices. That's... actually significant.
FOUR DEVICES showing the SAME THING! This is PERFECT evidence!
Four simultaneous device captures. What was the thermal signature and EMF reading correlation?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Different manufacturers, different technologies. The statistical probability of synchronized equipment malfunction across all four is effectively zero. I've isolated a thirty-second window where something was present in that room that shouldn't have been.

textVariants.text: Could correlated equipment malfunctions explain this? Electrical interference, environmental factors?
Could it all be equipment issues? You know how it is with sensitive gear...
SYNC EQUIPMENT MALFUNCTION is STATISTICALLY IMPOSSIBLE! This is HUGE!
Right, because synchronized malfunctions never happen. What's your explanation?
Could be interference. What's your take on that?
Statistically ZERO chance of malfunction! This is the BIGGEST story I've heard!
Regarding equipment malfunction hypothesis - what control measurements ruled out environmental factors?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: I considered that extensively. The devices are battery-powered and isolated. The thermal signature shows a localized temperature anomaly that moved deliberately - not random interference. And the audio includes structured sounds that match no conventional source.

textVariants.text: Send us the findings when they're published or available. If this holds up under independent scrutiny, it's significant. Thank you for applying real scientific methodology to this field.
Yeah, send the findings in if you want. Thanks for calling.
Send us EVERYTHING! This is REVOLUTIONARY! Thank you for being a REAL scientist!
Alright, that's... actually compelling. Send it in if you want. Thanks.
Good work. Send your findings in. We need more people doing real science.
This is PERFECT! Send us your research! You're AMAZING!
Please submit your full documentation for peer review and independent replication attempts. Rigorous methodology is exactly what this field needs.

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Appreciate the support, Vern. The evidence exists whether people want to believe it or not. My job is just to document it properly.
